channel.title: Cannot "log in" EasyRSC
channel.description:
hey guys
I tried many things to get this to work but in vain so i hope you guys can help me out.
I am trying to play Easyrsc [b]Alone[/b] so i can mess around but i can't seem to be able to get in game...everytime i try to connect with any usernames or password it says: Sorry! Unable to connect. check internet settings or try another world." and in the cmd windows it says: Java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect".
Things i have done so far to try to fix it:
-Turning my firewall off (I don't have any anti-virus) -Launching the run_client.bat as admin -Installing JDK -Changing the IP address from "127.0.0.1" in the client settings.ini to "LocalHost" -Restarting my computer & re-downloading EasyRSC -Used the Environment Variable Setter by Lin (didn't really know if it was needed but tried anyways)
I'm using windows vista.
The same thing happens with Moparscape..i hit start server before trying to log in but it doesn't work..
So any help would be appreciated :)

item.title: Cannot "log in" EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @sabotag sabotag
item.description:
@sabotag wrote:

I’ve added this line into build.xml :

<property name="src" location="src" />
<property name="build" location="build" />
<property name="doc" location="../doc" />
<property name="lib" location="lib" />
<property name="jar" location="rscd.jar" />
<property name="settings" location="settings.ini" />

<target name="compile">
	<delete file="${jar}" />
	<mkdir dir="${build}" />
	<javac srcdir="${src}" destdir="${build}" debug="on" target="1.5">
	  <classpath>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar"/>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar"/>
     [b]<pathelement location="${lib}/xmlpull.jar" />[/b]
		<pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/jmf.jar" />
		<pathelement path="${java.class.path}/"/>
	  </classpath>
	</javac>
	<jar basedir="${build}" destfile="${jar}" />
	<delete dir="${build}" />
</target>	
<target name="runserver">
	<java classname="org.rscdaemon.server.Server" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx512m" />
		<arg value="world.xml" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar" />
        [b]<pathelement location="${lib}/xmlpull.jar" />[/b]
			<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
			<pathelement location="quests/" />
			<pathelement path="${jar}/" />
		</classpath>
	</java>
</target>

It has resolved some errors but also added a ton of new errors…

I have to get something done and i will be back in a couple of hours to see if you guys replied. Thank you very much for helping me out!

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot "log in" EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Chances are you’re using apache ant to build your project, right? Well if so, you need to include xmlpull into your classpath withing build.xml

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot "log in" EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

I think you can just go through and add no arg constructers in all the classes it gives you errors in. I think i did that when i first started messing with the server sources cause i didnt even know what the hell xstream was lol. It ran but idk if it brought up any new bugs or anything. I dont see how it could anyway

item.title: Cannot "log in" EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

Google “xstream” and download it and then put the xpull jar in your libs folder of your server. Well obv java 7 is sexier lol… But 6 is a workaround as well

Also sabotage, you can have multiple jdks on your pc. You just have to specify in the .bat or in your IDEs project setting which one to use if you dont want to use your default(7)

Read full topic

item.description:
@sabotag wrote:

It seems to have fixed some of the errors but still says this:

Buildfile: C:\EasyRSC\Server\build.xml

runserver:
[java] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/xmlpull/v1/XmlPullParserFactory
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.io.xml.XppDriver.createParser(XppDri
ver.java:57)
[java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.io.xml.AbstractXppDriver.createReade
r(AbstractXppDriver.java:54)

r(AbstractXppDriver.java:65)

Manager.java:41)

tityHandler.java:333)

ava:113)
[java] at org.rscdaemon.server.io.WorldLoader.loadWorld(WorldLoader.jav
a:37)
[java] at org.rscdaemon.server.model.World.getWorld(World.java:83)
[java] at org.rscdaemon.server.Server.(Server.java:29)

arserFactory

I downloaded the files from http://xstream.codehaus.org/download.html . i’ve put the xstream file and xpp3 file into server/lib/ then compiled and then ran the bat file. Any ideas?

So when i try to start the server now, this text appears in the cmd prompt:

Buildfile: C:\Users\oooo\Desktop\EasyRSC\Server\build.xml

[java] java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError

item.title: Cannot "log in" EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

notepad++ is easier… its good it is set to localhost… open the settings.ini file and make sure that is set to localhost. then you need to compile your server and run the server then turn it on and you should be able to log on no problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot "log in" EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @sabotag sabotag
item.description:
@sabotag wrote:

Thank you for replying

I opened the file with notepad (Not sure how to do open it otherwise) and couldn’t find any IP at all.

package org.rscdaemon.server;

import org.rscdaemon.server.event.DelayedEvent;
import org.rscdaemon.server.event.SingleEvent;
import org.rscdaemon.server.util.*;
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.World;
import org.rscdaemon.server.net.RSCConnectionHandler;

import org.apache.mina.common.IoAcceptor;
import org.apache.mina.common.IoAcceptorConfig;
import org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.*;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.InetSocketAddress;
import java.util.Properties;

import javax.swing.UIManager;

/**

  • The entry point for RSC server.
    /
    public class Server {
    /    *

    • World instance
      /
      private static final World world = World.getWorld();
      /      *
    • The game engine
      /
      private GameEngine engine;
      /      *
    • The SocketAcceptor
      /
      private IoAcceptor acceptor;
      /      *
    • Update event - if the server is shutting down
      /
      private DelayedEvent updateEvent;
      /      *
    • The login server connection
      /
      /      *
    • Is the server running still?
      */
      private boolean running;

    public boolean running() {
    return running;
    }

    /**

    • Shutdown the server in 60 seconds
      */
      public boolean shutdownForUpdate() {
      if(updateEvent != null) {
      return false;
      }
      updateEvent = new SingleEvent(null, 65000) {
      public void action() {
      kill();
      }
      };
      world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(updateEvent);
      return true;
      }

    /**

    • MS till the server shuts down
      */
      public int timeTillShutdown() {
      if(updateEvent == null) {
      return -1;
      }
      return updateEvent.timeTillNextRun();
      }

    public void resetOnline() {
    try {
    File files = new File(“players/”);
    int count = 0;
    for(File f : files.listFiles()) {

     	if(f.getName().endsWith(".cfg")) {
 		count++;
 		Properties pr = new Properties();

 		FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(f);
 		pr.load(fis);
 		fis.close();
 		pr.setProperty("loggedin",  "false");
 		FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(f);
 		pr.store(fos, "Character Data.");
 		fos.close();
 	}
 	
 }
 Logger.print(count + " Accounts exist.", 3);
 } catch (Exception e) {
 	Logger.print(e.toString(), 1);
 }

    }

    /**

    • Creates a new server instance, which in turn creates a new
    • engine and prepares the server socket to accept connections.
      */
      public Server() {
      resetOnline();
      running = true;
      world.setServer(this);
      try {
      engine = new GameEngine();
      engine.start();
      acceptor = new SocketAcceptor();
      IoAcceptorConfig config = new SocketAcceptorConfig();
      config.setDisconnectOnUnbind(true);
      ((SocketSessionConfig)config.getSessionConfig()).setReuseAddress(true);
      acceptor.bind(new InetSocketAddress(“localhost”, GameVars.portNumber), new RSCConnectionHandler(engine), config);
      }
      catch (Exception e) {
      Logger.error(e);
      }
      }

    /**

    • Returns the game engine for this server
      */
      public GameEngine getEngine() {
      return engine;
      }

    public boolean isInitialized() {
    return engine != null;
    }

    /**

    • Kills the game engine and irc engine
      */
      public void kill() {
      GUI.resetVars();
      Logger.print(“CleanRSC Shutting Down…”, 3);
      running = false;
      engine.emptyWorld();
      }

    /**

    • Unbinds the socket acceptor
      */
      public void unbind() {
      try {
      acceptor.unbindAll();
      GUI.cout(“Socket Closed”, 3);
      }
      catch(Exception e) { }
      }

    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
    try {

     	UIManager.setLookAndFeel("com.sun.java.swing.plaf.windows.WindowsLookAndFeel");
 	//UIManager.setLookAndFeel("com.easynth.lookandfeel.EaSynthLookAndFeel");
 } catch (Exception e) {
 		
 	}
 	GUI.args = args;
 new GUI();

    }
    }

Thats everything…do i even need to start the server to play by myself? Because i tried that too and the command prompt closes by itself 2-3 seconds after i try to run it.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot "log in" EasyRSC
item.dc:creator: @sabotag sabotag
item.description:
@sabotag wrote:

hey guys

I tried many things to get this to work but in vain so i hope you guys can help me out.

I am trying to play Easyrsc Alone so i can mess around but i can’t seem to be able to get in game…everytime i try to connect with any usernames or password it says: Sorry! Unable to connect. check internet settings or try another world." and in the cmd windows it says: Java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect".

Things i have done so far to try to fix it:

-Turning my firewall off (I don’t have any anti-virus)
-Launching the run_client.bat as admin
-Installing JDK
-Changing the IP address from “127.0.0.1” in the client settings.ini to “LocalHost”
-Restarting my computer & re-downloading EasyRSC
-Used the Environment Variable Setter by Lin (didn’t really know if it was needed but tried anyways)

I’m using windows vista.

The same thing happens with Moparscape…i hit start server before trying to log in but it doesn’t work…

So any help would be appreciated

Read full topic
